{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 33-year-old woman at 17-weeks gestation with a painless mass in the right breast that has been present for three weeks without increasing in size. The physical examination shows dense breasts and a 2.5-cm rubbery, mobile mass that is nontender in the upper outer quadrant of the right breast. The biopsy shows rounded contour with overgrowth of fibrous and glandular tissue. Considering these features, we can eliminate options B (normal pregnancy-related changes) and C (fat necrosis). The most likely diagnosis would be a benign tumor of the breast, such as an adenofibroma or phyllodes tumor.", "answer_choice": "D"}
